passage_text: paracolon bacillus. Definitions: 1. any one of a number of diverse enteric bacteria that fail to ferment lactose promptly. The definition information for paracolon bacillus is provided by Stedman's. You can search our medical dictionary here.
paracolon bacteria. (microbiology). A group of bacteria intermediate between the Escherichia-Aerobacter genera and the Salmonella-Shigella group. 1  Facebook.

Medical Definition of PARACOLON. : any of several coliform bacteria that do not ferment lactose, are causative agents of a number of human gastroenteritides, and have sometimes been grouped in a separate genus (Paracolobactrum) but are now assigned to other genera (as Escherichia).

An obsolete term for an enteric pathogen of the (obsolete) genus Bacterium that does not ferment lactose or saccharose, ferments glucose and mannitol, and produces indole, which may be associated with mini-epidemics in closed populations. The term is not used in the working medical parlance.
